bio:treatment.description: Stems erect, intricately branched, mostly 1–3.5(–4.5) dm. Leaves: proximalmost blade linear to linear-lanceolate or linear-elliptic, mainly 5–25 × 1–4 mm, tapering to slender base, densely grayish scurfy. Staminate flowers mainly confined to distal axils. Fruiting bracteoles oblong-cuneate to obovate in profile, (1.8–)2–2.3 × 1.1–1.5 mm, terminal tooth reduced to mere cusp between larger lateral ones.
saline areas growing with shadscale, seepweed

verbatim.text: Flowering summer-fall. Saline areas growing with shadscale, seepweed, Russian thistle, fine-textured substrates; 2300 m; Colo.
